availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Terhune (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rachel Stagg Terhune on December 9, 1844. Father of Eugene Terhune, William Terhune, Abraham Terhune, John Terhune, Prudence Terhune, James Terhune, Ruth Terhune, Charles B. Terhune, and Mary P. Terhune. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850, 1860, and 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 337; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 77; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 6, p. 1; Kentucky, County Marriages, 1783-1965, Ancestry, Mercer County, Kentucky, Devember 9, 1844; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Mercer County, KY, June/July 1863, p. 14, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
